newsitem.title: JAPAN: Honda shares down on profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: Honda shares down on profit-taking.

text.p: Shares in Honda Motor Co Ltd slipped on Thursday morning as profit-taking emerged after the recent sharp rally, traders said.
The auto maker's share price was down 70 yen at 3,400 yen at 0051 GMT. Volume was 2.798 million shares, making it the second-heaviest volume on the first section of the Tokyo Stock Exchange.

"The pace of the rally was too quick, so profit-taking emerged. Technically speaking, the price had deviated 18 percent from the five-week moving average and trade had been overheated," said a broker at a major securities house.
